function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Reliance on existing data may lead to overestimation of simulation validity and not account for behavioral influences.","Impact":"False sense of confidence in simulation results, neglect of important behavioral influences.","Mitigation":"Combine data-driven behavior with user-supplied information, continually update and validate data, and provide explanations for the limitations of the simulation.","Technologies":"Data analytics, machine learning, visualization tools.","People":"Users relying on simulation results for decision-making, stakeholders in space and architecture design.","Owner":"Data analysts, simulation developers, decision-makers."},{"Description":"Lack of detailed exploration of human-building interactions in simulation tools.","Impact":"Inaccurate representation of human behavior in building environments, limited ability to predict and mitigate contagious disease propagation.","Mitigation":"Develop simulation tools with a high level of detail that realistically simulate human-building interactions, integrate contagious disease propagation models.","Technologies":"Occupancy simulation systems, contagious disease modeling, data analytics.","People":"Users interested in assessing epidemic contexts, stakeholders in building design and public health.","Owner":"Simulation developers, public health experts, building designers."}]}
